result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Mitchell S. Bowman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Count 1 - 3 years
Successfully complete probation on counts 9, 10 and 11
Not engage in any conduct which would lead an impartial magistrate to find probable cause exists to believe that the defendant has committed a violation of the criminal laws of the United States or the State of Wisconsin or of any ordinances adopting the same.
No unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18.  Not go upon or enter any premises where a reasonable person may believe that juveniles may be present, including but not limited to day cares, schools, parks, sporting event, carnivals, swimming pools, malls, matinees, etc unless approved by the defendant's probation agent in writing
Submit to, comply with and complete any counseling, assessments, treatment and/or AODA requested by the probation agent and follow through with any and all treatment recommendations made
 Within 5 days after first contact with each provider, execute any and all written releases to allow his agent to discuss defendant's assessment, counseling or treatment progress with DA's office
Provide DA's Office with all necessary written proof of full compliance with this agreement prior to review date
If complies - dismiss
Non-compliance - formal sentencing
Bond continued

A.D.A Veronica Isherwood appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Jelinski.
Amended information filed by the state.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
Statements by A.D.A.
Statements by Atty. Jelinski.
Victim impact statement by K.S.
The defendant enters pleas of no contest to Counts 1, 9, 10, and 11 of the amended information.
Pleas accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant was found guilty on Counts 9, 10, and 11. Count 1 will be subject to a DPA.  All other remaining counts are dismissed and read in. 
On Counts 9, 10, and 11, the Court orders that sentence be withheld and places defendant on probation for a period of 3 years on each count, to run concurrently.
See file for conditions and terms of DPA.
Bond continued on Count 1.
No restitution is requested.
Appeal rights were provided.
